column2: jimbo, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Was diagnosed with diabetes in July (14.2 A1C) went on Metformin 1000 mg and amaryl 2mg twice a day. Worked but still had highs and really bad lows (50-55). Doctor game me some janumet samples--amazing--nothing over 100 even eating what I want. A new doctor swithed me to a newer pill (Tradjenta) with Metformin--what a joke!!! All the old highs came back--200-300. Switched back and now is down to normal again like I don't even have diabetes, These pills are great, slight side effect with a stuffy nose at night but it works so well that I take one janumet in the morning and then a generic metformin at night and that helps the stuffy nose. Look online at the janumet website where the first prescription is free and then for the next year it is $5 a month--thats right $5 a month. Then the second year you can switch to januvia for the same deal and just take regular metformin. That is my plans. Good luck

It makes me feel much better.

column2: mdl, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: i have pcos and had been on metformin.  even with eating right and exercise maintaining or losing weight was difficult.  a friend told me about janumet.  i've been very happy.  i'm slowly losing.  months i don't i maintain.  my condition is controlled well. the only time i have loose bowels is first thing in the morning if i don't get enough sleep.  i have noticed my eyes going a little, but i have a couple medications that could do that.  and maybe that's my age.  i am over 40 now.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i accidentally learned that i was diabetic, i started having symptoms, and my dad(diabetic) said let me check you--well 522! went to docs 2 days later and she started me on the Janumet. its been a week and im down to the 130-150's(that includes fasting counts) So I am overal happy with the results after just a week. Side effects ive experienced-stomach pains, diarhea, nasueas, eye focusing issues(blurry things). But being my sugar is down, i do have more energy back!! :)

column2: Gamesmasterz, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: TC44509, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My blood sugar level was over 500 when I was in hospital and found out I have diabetes.  I have been taking Janumet and within a week my sugar was down to 170's!  I have noticed a few side effects: headache, bathroom issues, dizziness, pain in eye sockets, trouble seeing, etc. But could be the high sugar, change in eating habit or the meds.  I am also on med for high blood pressure.  It sky rocketed to something like 225/125 when in the hospital.  Over all I feel much better!!  Only issue I have now is not being able to see clearly.  But that seems to be getting better.  I will continue taking this medication, it seems to be working rather well.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Newly diagnosed, my sugar counts were "OFF" the scale, yes I mean "OFF" the scale.  At first I was taking Mel.(?) alone, did not help. Dr. put me on Janumet. I am not a person that likes to take meds.I had and still occasionally get the usual diarrhea and cramping.  All that I can suggest is go see a dietician and exercise if you want to beat this.  It does work but requires dedication from yourself.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking janumet for about a month.  My average fasting blood sugar has also risen by approximately 40 to 50 points.  I do believe a slight weight loss has begun due to not processing as much blood sugar into unneeded energy and eventually fat.  To counter this, I have upped my intake of a supplement called Super Citrimax which contains niacin bound chromium.  While this supplement is by no means a cure-all, it has helped me.I had been on Avandia, have no signs of heart disease, but my doctor switched me to Janumet because he felt it to be "something stronger".  At my next appointment, perhaps sooner, I am going to ask to switch back to Avandia because it works better for me.
